alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 27 at 2:27PM MDT until March 27 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 7 PM MDT TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong west to northwest winds combined with low humidity this afternoon will continue to produce several hours of critical fire weather conditions over northeast and east central New Mexico. Winds will turn strong over the northeast highlands and adjacent northeastern plains on Tuesday afternoon, leading the potential for more marginally critical to critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Central Highlands (Zone 125) from 1 pm to 7 pm MDT today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to near 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
